subject: Throttle Issue Order #SSN2641
description_text:
Hello,

I am having a persistent throttle issue that is getting worse.

My throttle pedal says it is depressed when it is not in multiple game
titles.
I have recalibrated and adjusted it multiple times as well as have it
grounded correctly.

Can you provide additional information on this issue or provide a
replacement?

Please advise.

Best regards,
Robert

conversations.body_text: Hi Robbie Francisco,    Please don't worry—we'll repair or replace it for you. First, please provide us with a video showing the issue you're experiencing.

I will try to provide a video but it is an intermittent issue. The throttle
pedal mechanism is not sticking, it seems to be an issue with the encoder.
The pedal returns to 0% position but in games it still says it is 100%
depressed.

I would like to also note this issue is happening on the previous and
newest software.

Is there any other data I can provide?

Thank you,
Robbie

Hi Robbie Francisco,   If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

I will try grounding the sim chassis to the computer itself next. This has
not been an issue until recently though and I have had these pedals for
some time. The pedal control box is also already grounded to the pedals.

Do you have any feedback on this?

Thank you.

On Tue, Nov 18, 2025, 10:26 PM support@simsonn.com
Hi Robbie Francisco,  As long as the PC case is connected to the pedal’s metal screws and the control box is connected to the pedal’s metal screws, there should be no further issues.
